channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024040665
item.description:
Report X-2024040665

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During Preload sort on 04/09/2024, a Hazmat package was discovered to be damaged and leaking contents after it was unloaded from trailer. After discovery of damage, Package was taken to QA for further inspection DescribePack: Two five liter bottles of Medvators Rapicide PA Part B High level disinfectant leaking contents from loose caps inside package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After inspection, damaged package placed in a red plastic Fedex Ground Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in Hazmat cage on site for future processing by QA

item.title: Report X-2024040672
item.description:
Report X-2024040672

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: while unloading a trailer during preload, a package handler noticed the package was wet. They informed their manager who called over the hazmat team that inspected the package and discovered that the caps were loose on all 4 containers. DescribePack: all 4 caps were loose on the bottles contained inside the package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put in a yellow drum lined with a blue hazmat bag and then placed in the hazmat cage under ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2024040671
item.description:
Report X-2024040671

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and punctured in damaged hazmat cage in terminal upon arrival. Both gallon bottles of Chemsearch Hercules Advanced Heavy Duty Cleaner were removed and inspected. All caps were tightened and secured with 1 of the 2 bottles having a slightly less amount of solution than the other. Liquid spillage and small punctures to the box can be seen on one side of the box. DescribePack: Internal and External partition corroded by inner liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was stood upright and brought over to Damage Hazmat cage for immediate inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024040658
item.description:
Report X-2024040658

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO THE BELT TO TRAILER TO CHECK ON LEAKING PACKAGE UPON FURTHER INSPECTION QA SAW THAT THE CONTENTS INSIDE WERE LEAKING AND THUS ITEM WAS REMOVED FROM TRAILER DescribePack: QA SAW THAT THE CANS INSIDE WERE ALREADY DENTED PRIOR TO SHIPMENT SINCE THERE WAS NO OUTER DAMAGE TO PACKAGE AND DENTS WERE ON CANS INSIDE ONE OF THE CANS INSIDE WAS LEAKING FROM THE TOP SINCE CLIPS GOT LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA REMOVED PACKAGE FROM TRAILER AND PLACED IT IN A HAZMAT SAFE CONTAINER AND MOVED IT TO A SAFE LOCATION TO PROCESS

item.title: Report X-2024040384
item.description:
Report X-2024040384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler informed QA that they had a leaking hazmat with a hole in it and that they believed that it had fallen off the rollers. QA quickly got the hazmat into a hazmat bag and tote before it could leak onto anything. DescribePack: A small hole about a centimeter or so in size was found in one of the upper corners of the jerrican. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was put immediately into a hazmat bag before the leak could spread to anything.

item.title: Report X-2024040392
item.description:
Report X-2024040392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the inbound sort, the hazmat package was mishandled roughly unto the belt causing the unsecured cap to start leaking. DescribePack: The cap was loose and cracked causing a leak from the top and leading to spillage of most of the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was placed on the released on the floor to contain the spillage.

  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report X-2024040309
item.description:
Report X-2024040309

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During inbound unloading, the package was mishandled and loaded upside down, loosening the caps and causing a puncture of the seal inside the caps of 2 bottles. DescribePack: The caps were loosened and the seals underneath were punctured causing extensive leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quick action was taken by bagging the hazmat package and covering the spillage with kitty litter. Hazard markers were set for safe passage around the spillage area.

item.title: Report X-2024040290
item.description:
Report X-2024040290

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: ELMSFORD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was not loaded properly on trailer, once they opened the trailer door they found the package not facing the correct orientation arrows DescribePack: loose cap caused it to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: place soaked package in a hazmat drum to contain the spilling, also used absorbent material to clean the spill.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking on the 100-load side and was contained in a tote when found. DescribePack: One of the bottles was missing a cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a tote and any spill was cleaned up using a combination of towels and chemical neutralizer.
